alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 3:12AM EST until December 24 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chill ranging 5 below zero to 5 above zero. * WHERE...All portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 11 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in frost bite or hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds through tonight may cause power outages, compounding the danger of the cold Wind Chill values. If you lose power and use a generator or other heating device make sure to follow the manufacturers safety instructions. Never use charcoal or gas grills indoors.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
